page.title: 01HEADON,UPTON,ASKHAM
page.content: The area surrounding Upton, Headon and Askham is predominantly used for farming. Many farms punctuate the landscape, all of them concentrating on either cereal crops, root crops or grass land and some dairy, sheep and pig farming being practised. Hens are also kept. The land lies between 30 and 40 metres above sea level. It originates from old woodland and traces of these can be seen spotted around. Recently the two largest woods namely those of Gamston and Eaton have been purchased by the Nottinghamshire Trust for Nature Conservation. Another recent development is the preparation for electrification of the railway through the block. Recently imposed quotas from central government are the largest concern for local farmers at this time.
